meanings.definition: A store that sells food and supplies to military personnel.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers went to the commissary to buy snacks.
meanings.sent2: My dad works at the commissary on the military base.
meanings.sent3: Why did the banana go to the commissary? To find its peel-mate!
meanings.sent4: The commissary is a treasure trove of goodies for the troops.
meanings.sent5: The commissary smelled of fresh bread and coffee, enticing the hungry soldiers.

meanings.definition: An officer in charge of supplying food and provisions.
meanings.sent1: The commissary ensured that the troops had enough rations for the mission.
meanings.sent2: The commissary organized the delivery of supplies to the army base.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chef become a commissary? He wanted to be the top banana in food distribution!
meanings.sent4: The commissary was the general of the food army, strategizing meal plans.
meanings.sent5: The commissary's role was crucial in keeping the soldiers well-fed and ready for action.

meanings.definition: A person who is authorized to act as a representative.
meanings.sent1: As a commissary, she had the authority to sign contracts on behalf of the company.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer appointed him as the commissary for the legal proceedings.
meanings.sent3: Why did the actor become a commissary? He wanted to represent the drama community!
meanings.sent4: She acted as the commissary of goodwill, spreading positivity wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The commissary was the face of the organization, embodying its values and mission.
